text: Ponerorchis bifoliatum (synonym Amitostigma bifoliatum) is a species of plant in the family Orchidaceae. It is endemic to China, known only from Gansu and Sichuan.Flora of China v 25 p 130, 棒距无柱兰 bang ju wu zhu lan, Amitostigma bifoliatum China Plant Specialist Group. 2004. Amitostigma bifoliatum. The IUCN Red List of Threatened Species 2004. Downloaded on 10 September 2015. It produces pale purple flowers.Amitostigma bifoliatum. Flora of China. ==Taxonomy== The species was first described in 1936 by Tsin Tang and Fa Tsuan Wang, as Amitostigma bifoliatum. A molecular phylogenetic study in 2014 found that species of Amitostigma, Neottianthe and Ponerorchis were mixed together in a single clade, making none of the three genera monophyletic as then circumscribed. Amitostigma and Neottianthe were subsumed into Ponerorchis, with this species becoming Ponerorchis bifoliata. == References == Category:Endemic orchids of China bifoliata Category:Endangered plants Category:Flora of Gansu Category:Orchids of Sichuan Category:Plants described in 1936 Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Ponerorchis bifoliata
